Reviews.Title: “Poor quality service”
Reviews.Author: m_badran80
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in the period from 11th February 2011 to 13th Feb. 2011. I choosed this hotel because of its price and the location of it. It is in front of an "S Bahn" station which is type of transport inside big cities like Berlin. Also the hotel lies inside one of the commercial centers in Berlin beside big malls and a lot of restaurants, so there was no problem with the location or the price. Coming to the food: It was good and open buffet. People working in the reception were unfriendly at all, they were insisting to speak German all the time , any help i have got it to see the city was from people working in the street beside the hotel. The room was not so good and it was cold in relation to weather in this period of year, there was a problem in the windows and when i tried to ask for help , no body helped me. I would not try to come back to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marina K
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here in a single room on the first floor (American second floor). The room itself was quite large will good amenities, such as an ensuite, wardrobe big enough to store my luggage, television (German-language channels only), and tea and coffee facilities. While the room was starting to look a little dated, it was exceptionally clean. The bathroom was new and in excellent condition. The selection of breakfast foods was extensive. There is a lift in the building, but for some reason it only stops on 'half' floors, so you will need to be able to carry your luggage up at least one flight of stairs if you stay here (half a flight up to the lift, and half a flight to get to your floor). Wifi is free, you simply need to ask for the password at reception. The hotel is in an excellent location opposite Charlottenburg station. Trains run very regularly and it is easy to get around. I arrived in Berlin at around 11pm, and felt quite safe making my way to the hotel on the train and walking from the station by myself at such a late hour. Reception is staffed 24 hours. I found the worst thing about this hotel was the pillow - mine had a feather or down filling and offered absolutely no support! I woke every day with a sore neck and contemplated hunting down an Ikea to buy my own pillow to use instead!

Reviews.Title: “value for money,”
Reviews.Author: albaloo428
Reviews.Content: we stayed with family in 2 separated room, Hotel look a little old and dirty, but service was ok, easy check in, free internet and fine breakfast, recommended for low budget seekers.

Reviews.Title: “Good place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Stodds73
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and I thought that it was great for the money. The breakfast was nothing special but good. And the wifi is now free if u are a guest. The room was a good size. The only bad thing was that one morning there was no hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but”
Reviews.Author: kadda2
Reviews.Content: ... the hotel Abendstern has a really nice location directly at the station "charlottenburg". from here, you can easily get into the sightseeing places of berlin. furthermore, if you have to get to the icc (congress center), there is a bus station 5 minutes away that will take you there within a few minutes. a plus: directly at the s-bahn station is a small supermarket that is open for 24h/7days - that is great especially if you come back late and want an additional water, beer or something to eat. the prices are ok and the staff is friendly. BUT: (1) the breakfast is really bad (old bread, cheese etc.), (2) you have to have luck with the room - there are some nice rooms but you can also get a room where you sleep directly next to the lift, i.e. everyone can look into your room and in your bed who uses the lift, (3) some rooms are really really dirty (black hairs, dirty walls, dirty beds). Summary: Ok for a weekend but if you stay for a congress or want to make a longer stay it is not the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: Kalina1616
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but clean. Their website makes it seem like the wireless internet is free and easily accessible, but you actually have to pay 8 euros an hour for it. It says they have an elevator, but you still have to walk up a flight of stairs to get to it and another flight after you get off. rooms have attached bathrooms, but they are very small and closet-like. The one good thing about the hotel is the location...right across the street from teh Charlottenburg S-bahn station and right around the corner from the bus stop to/from the airport. In a cool area that seemed less touristy that Kudamm area. Lots of Felafel and asian restaurants and markets around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great place.”
Reviews.Author: pumpula
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel. I was a little surprised that the room was so clean and nice. The hotel situation was great; train station just next to it and shopping area just behind it. We also have a little balcony in our room, because our room was in the streetside. Trains noices bother a little bit, but not much. Everyone of the staff doesn't speak good english, but that was not a problem. Breakfast was good, but the breakfast room was tiny. There's not minibar in the room, but in short trip that doesn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “xmas at the abendstern”
Reviews.Author: ipswichjimlee
Reviews.Content: just back from a week at the abendstern hotel in charlottenberg berlin. hotel is very clean & comfortable, reception manned 24hrs. staff very friendly & helpful. good buffet style breakfast with plenty of variety. clean towels bed linen daily. ideally situated close to s-bahn train station (just across the road). good shopping facilities nearby. city centre & all major attractions just a few train stations away,if youre feeling energetic city centre only about 30 mins walk away. If you get the oppertunity visit the sachsenhausen concentration camp memorial museum, nearest s-bahn station orianberg ( s1). fascinating insight into what went on there during the war. Free admission, but closed on mondays. i would certainly stay at the hotel abendstern again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: wibble101
Reviews.Content: And thats all I really want. Sure there are plenty of other nicer hotels around, but I like the Abendstern simple enough rooms with decent facilities, friendly breakfast room. The other really handy thing about the Abendstern is that it is a stones throw from Charlottenburg station (One minute hotel door to platform). There are overground trains every 2-3 minutes into the centre of town during the day, which is really nice as you get to see things rather than been on the underground and it's especially useful for getting home in the early hours after a nigh out. That said if you need the tube it's also one minute walk away. I've stayed at Abendstern three times now (and probably again later inthe year) , it's by no means the Ritz and may not suit everybody. But if you are happy with cheap and cheerful in a nice area with great transport links then it's definately worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Problems”
Reviews.Author: Richwyl50
Reviews.Content: The problems started when I arrived at 1:00 PM and was told that my room wouldn't be ready until 3:00 PM. I was tired from a transatlantic flight and would have liked to check in for a rest. Then I was given a room on the 4th floor (5th floor American), with no elevator! I got changed to a room on the 2nd floor, which was adequate. I noticed construction on the stairways and construction material in the courtyard. Well, they are building an elevator, but right now there is just construction noise. It started at 7:00 AM and continued all day. Note too that on the street side there is construction on the S-Bahn across the street. This is not the hotel's fault, but it is there. After two days I told the management I was leaving. They were not very pleased but I explained that I had asked for a quiet room and was not told about the construction. I don't consider this good customer service. I also believe I was charged more than I should have as my weekly rate was based on different daily rates. This was also my first experience in Germany in which taxes were added to the room rate; I have always been quoted a rate that included all taxes. The hotel is a budget hotel, similar to the City Pension right down the street where I have stayed before. I don't expect a lot of amenities, just a good clean bed, but I should have been informed about the construction when I made my reservation and when I checked in.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Abendstern
HotelInfo.Address: Stuttgarter Platz 8, 10627 Berlin, Germany
